anesthesiology.description: Management of pain and vital functions during medical procedures through various types of anesthesia.

subsections.name: general_anesthesia
subsections.description: Induction of unconsciousness and loss of sensation during surgery using inhaled or intravenous agents.

subsections.name: invasive_procedures
subsections.description: Anesthesia services associated with procedures involving significant tissue penetration or risk.

subsections.name: monitoring_anesthesia_related
subsections.description: Continuous assessment of vital signs and anesthesia depth to ensure patient safety during procedures.

subsections.name: obstetric_anesthesia
subsections.description: Pain relief techniques used during labor, delivery, and cesarean section.

subsections.name: surgical_anesthesia_by_region
subsections.description: Regional techniques like spinal, epidural, or nerve blocks to anesthetize specific areas of the body.

dental.description: Diagnostic, preventive, and corrective procedures related to oral and dental health.

subsections.name: diagnostic_dental
subsections.description: Evaluation of oral health through clinical examination, radiographs, and diagnostic tools.

subsections.name: preventive_dental
subsections.description: Procedures that help prevent dental issues, including cleanings, sealants, and fluoride treatments.

subsections.name: restorative_dental
subsections.description: Treatments that restore function and appearance of teeth, such as fillings and crowns.

subsections.name: oral_surgery
subsections.description: Surgical procedures in the oral cavity including extractions and corrective jaw surgeries.

subsections.name: endodontics
subsections.description: Dental specialty focusing on root canal treatments and diseases of dental pulp.

subsections.name: periodontics
subsections.description: Diagnosis and treatment of gum diseases and supporting structures of the teeth.

subsections.name: prosthodontics
subsections.description: Design and fitting of artificial replacements for teeth and other parts of the mouth.

subsections.name: orthodontics
subsections.description: Diagnosis and correction of misaligned teeth and jaws using braces and other appliances.

laboratory.description: Analysis of body fluids and samples to support diagnosis, monitoring, and screening.

subsections.name: chemistry
subsections.description: Includes general chemistry tests and specialized panels such as liver, renal, electrolyte, and enzyme analysis.

subsections.name: hematology
subsections.description: Tests related to blood composition, including complete blood count, differential count, and coagulation studies.

subsections.name: endocrinology
subsections.description: Hormonal analysis including thyroid, diabetes-related, and other hormone-level assessments.

subsections.name: immunology
subsections.description: Assessment of immune function, including autoantibody detection, allergy panels, and general immune profiling.

subsections.name: infectious_disease
subsections.description: Identification of pathogens including viral, bacterial, and parasitic agents.

subsections.name: urine_based_testing
subsections.description: Analysis of urine specimens for urinalysis, microalbumin levels, and urinary electrolytes.

subsections.name: nutritional_assessment
subsections.description: Evaluation of vitamin and mineral levels to detect deficiencies or nutritional imbalances.

subsections.name: inflammatory_assays
subsections.description: Tests that measure inflammatory markers such as CRP, ESR, and calprotectin.

subsections.name: specialized_panels
subsections.description: Advanced diagnostic panels including iron studies, metabolic profiles, and tumor markers.

specialty.description: Non-surgical, organ-based clinical disciplines such as cardiology, neurology, and psychiatry.

subsections.name: cardiology
subsections.description: Diagnosis and treatment of heart and cardiovascular conditions.

subsections.name: pulmonology
subsections.description: Focus on lung and respiratory system disorders.

subsections.name: neurology
subsections.description: Diagnosis and treatment of brain, spinal cord, and nervous system disorders.

subsections.name: psychiatry
subsections.description: Assessment and management of mental health conditions and behavioral disorders.

subsections.name: rehabilitation
subsections.description: Therapeutic interventions to restore function and mobility after illness or injury.

subsections.name: urology
subsections.description: Management of urinary tract and male reproductive health conditions.

subsections.name: ophthalmology
subsections.description: Medical and surgical care of the eyes and vision system.

subsections.name: obstetrics_gynecology
subsections.description: Care related to female reproductive health, pregnancy, and childbirth.

pathology.description: Microscopic and laboratory analysis of tissues, cells, and bodily fluids for disease diagnosis.

subsections.name: histopathology
subsections.description: Examination of tissue samples under a microscope to study disease manifestations and cellular changes.

subsections.name: cytopathology
subsections.description: Study of individual cell samples, typically for cancer diagnosis or infectious screening.

subsections.name: molecular_pathology
subsections.description: Analysis of DNA, RNA, and proteins to detect genetic and molecular abnormalities in diseases.

subsections.name: microbiology
subsections.description: Isolation and identification of microorganisms such as bacteria, fungi, and viruses in body specimens.

subsections.name: blood_bank_transfusion
subsections.description: Testing, preparation, and provision of blood products for transfusion purposes.

imaging.description: Diagnostic techniques that create visual representations of the internal structures of the body.

subsections.name: xray
subsections.description: Imaging using X-rays to visualize bones, chest, and other dense structures.

subsections.name: ultrasound
subsections.description: Diagnostic imaging using sound waves to create real-time images of internal organs, vessels, and fetuses.

subsections.name: ct_scan
subsections.description: Cross-sectional imaging using computed tomography to provide detailed anatomical views.

subsections.name: mri
subsections.description: Magnetic resonance imaging using magnetic fields and radio waves to produce detailed body images.

subsections.name: nuclear_medicine
subsections.description: Imaging using small amounts of radioactive material to assess function and structure of organs.

procedures.description: Invasive and non-invasive clinical interventions including surgical and therapeutic treatments.

subsections.name: minor_clinical_procedures
subsections.description: Low-risk, outpatient procedures such as injections, wound care, and simple excisions.

subsections.name: major_surgical_procedures
subsections.description: Invasive surgical operations typically requiring anesthesia and operating room facilities.

subsections.name: laparo_endoscopic_procedures
subsections.description: Minimally invasive procedures using scopes such as laparoscopy and endoscopy.

subsections.name: organ_targeted_procedures
subsections.description: Surgical interventions focused on specific organs like the kidney, liver, or gallbladder.

subsections.name: vascular_interventions
subsections.description: Procedures addressing conditions of the arteries, veins, and circulatory system.

subsections.name: musculoskeletal_surgery
subsections.description: Orthopedic procedures involving bones, joints, and connective tissue structures.

subsections.name: neurosurgical_interventions
subsections.description: Surgeries performed on the brain, spine, or peripheral nervous system.

subsections.name: therapeutic_non_surgical
subsections.description: Non-surgical treatments such as dialysis, radiation therapy, ESWL, and chemotherapy.

subsections.name: reproductive_procedures
subsections.description: Procedures involving reproductive health, such as vasectomy and tubal ligation.
